TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit StatisticFormula extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Calculates statistical formulas.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Formulas can be loosely grouped into the following categories: distributions, including inverse distributions; tests; and basic statistical formulas. Each group has common characteristics with respect to their input and return values.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AnovaResult Anova (double probability, string inputSeriesNames);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AnovaResult Anova(float64 probability, string inputSeriesNames) cil managed
Public Function Anova (probability As Double, inputSeriesNames As String) As AnovaResult
public: System::Windows::Forms::DataVisualization::Charting::AnovaResult ^ Anova(double probability, System::String ^ inputSeriesNames);
member this.Anova : double * string -> System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AnovaResult

Docs.param: The alpha value, which is the probability that the hypothesis is rejected. The allowable range is 0-1.
A comma-delimited list of input series names.
Docs.summary: Performs an ANOVA test to determine whether there is a statistically significant difference between the mean values of two or more groups of data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An ANOVA test is used to test the difference between the means of two or more groups of data.
Two or more groups of series data must be specified, and each series must have the same number of data points; otherwise, an exception will be raised.
If a specified input series does not exist in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesCollection> at the time of the method call, an exception will be thrown.

Docs.param: The first value for the beta function.
The second value for the beta function.
Docs.summary: Returns the beta function value for two given values.
Docs.returns: A value that represents the beta function for the two given values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method returns the beta function value for two given values that are specified by `m` and `n`.

MemberSignature.Value: public double Correlation (string firstInputSeriesName, string secondInputSeriesName);
.method public hidebysig instance float64 Correlation(string firstInputSeriesName, string secondInputSeriesName) cil managed
Public Function Correlation (firstInputSeriesName As String, secondInputSeriesName As String) As Double
public: double Correlation(System::String ^ firstInputSeriesName, System::String ^ secondInputSeriesName);
member this.Correlation : string * string -> double

Docs.summary: Returns the correlation value for two data series.
Docs.returns: A value that represents the correlation between two data series.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Correlation measures the relationship between two data sets that are scaled to be independent of the unit of measurement. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.StatisticFormula.Correlation%2A> method returns the covariance of two data sets divided by the product of their standard deviations, and always ranges from -1 to 1.
Use correlation to determine whether two ranges of data move together; that is, whether large values of one set are associated with large values of the other (positive correlation), whether small values of one set are associated with large values of the other (negative correlation), or whether values in both sets are unrelated (correlation near zero).
If a specified input series does not exist in the series collection at the time of the method call, an exception will be thrown. An exception will also be raised if the specified series do not have the same number of data points.

Docs.summary: Returns the covariance value for two data series.
Docs.returns: A value that represents the covariance between two data series.

Docs.summary: Performs a two-sample F Test using the F distribution. This test is used to determine if the samples have different variances.

MemberSignature.Value: public double InverseFDistribution (double probability, int firstDegreeOfFreedom, int secondDegreeOfFreedom);
.method public hidebysig instance float64 InverseFDistribution(float64 probability, int32 firstDegreeOfFreedom, int32 secondDegreeOfFreedom) cil managed
Public Function InverseFDistribution (probability As Double, firstDegreeOfFreedom As Integer, secondDegreeOfFreedom As Integer) As Double
public: double InverseFDistribution(double probability, int firstDegreeOfFreedom, int secondDegreeOfFreedom);
member this.InverseFDistribution : double * int * int -> double

Docs.param: The alpha value, which is the probability that the hypothesis is rejected. The allowable range is 0-1.
Docs.summary: Returns the inverse of the F cumulative distribution.
Docs.returns: A value from the inverse F distribution function.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method returns the F value for the given F distribution probability.
The F distribution can be used in an F-test that compares the degree of variability in two data sets.
This method may return an exception depending on the parameter values.

Docs.exception: Condition: Cannot continue calculation using specified parameter values because of limitation.

Docs.summary: Returns the inverse of the standard normal cumulative distribution.
Docs.returns: A value from the inverse standard normal cumulative distribution function.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method returns the F value for the given F distribution probability.
It is assumed that the distribution has a mean of 0 (zero) and a standard deviation of one.

MemberSignature.Value: public double Mean (string inputSeriesName);
.method public hidebysig instance float64 Mean(string inputSeriesName) cil managed
Public Function Mean (inputSeriesName As String) As Double
public: double Mean(System::String ^ inputSeriesName);
member this.Mean : string -> double

Docs.summary: Returns the average of all data points stored in the specified series.
Docs.returns: A value that represents the average of all data points.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to calculate the mean (that is, the average) of the points stored in a series.
If the specified input series does not exist in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesCollection> at the time of the method call, an exception will be thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: public double Median (string inputSeriesName);
.method public hidebysig instance float64 Median(string inputSeriesName) cil managed
Public Function Median (inputSeriesName As String) As Double
public: double Median(System::String ^ inputSeriesName);
member this.Median : string -> double

Docs.summary: Returns the median of all data points in the specified series.
Docs.returns: A value that represents the median.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to calculate the median of the points stored in a series.
The median is the middle value of a sample set, where half of the members are greater in size and half the members are lesser in size.
If the specified input series does not exist in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesCollection> at the time of the method call, an exception will be thrown.
